text.1:
Dalam ayat 1-2 disebutkan bahwa Nabi Muhammad sedang berselubung dengan selimut karena diliputi perasaan takut melihat rupa Malaikat Jibril, lalu turunlah wahyu yang memerintahkan agar segera bangun dan memperingatkan umat yang masih sesat itu supaya mereka mengenal jalan yang benar.

Perkataan "qum" (bangunlah) menunjukkan bahwa seorang rasul harus rajin, ulet, dan tidak mengenal putus asa karena ejekan orang yang tidak senang menerima seruannya. Rasul tidak boleh malas dan berpangku tangan. Semenjak ayat ini turun, Nabi Muhammad tidak pernah berhenti melaksanakan tugas dakwah. Sepanjang hidupnya diisi dengan berbagai macam kegiatan yang berguna bagi kepentingan umat dan penyiaran agama Islam.

Peringatan-peringatan yang beliau sampaikan kepada penduduk Mekah yang masih musyrik pada waktu itu, berupa kedahsyatan siksaan Allah di hari Kiamat kelak. Untuk menyelamatkan diri dari azab tersebut, manusia hendaknya mengenal Allah dan patuh mengikuti perintah Rasul saw.
text.2:

Rasul tidak boleh malas dan berpangku tangan. Semenjak ayat ini turun, Nabi Muhammad tidak pernah berhenti melaksanakan tugas dakwah. Sepanjang hidupnya diisi dengan berbagai macam kegiatan yang berguna bagi kepentingan umat dan penyiaran agama Islam.

Peringatan-peringatan yang beliau sampaikan kepada penduduk Mekah yang masih musyrik pada waktu itu, berupa kedahsyatan siksaan Allah di hari Kiamat kelak. Untuk menyelamatkan diri dari azab tersebut, manusia hendaknya mengenal Allah dan patuh mengikuti perintah Rasul saw.
text.3:
Ayat ini memerintahkan agar Nabi Muhammad mengagungkan Allah dengan bertakbir dan menyerahkan segala urusan kepada kehendak-Nya. Beliau dilarang mencari pertolongan selain kepada-Nya.

Mengagungkan Allah dengan segenap jiwa dan raga tentu menumbuhkan kepribadian yang tangguh dan tidak mudah goyah. Sebab, manusia yang beriman memandang bahwa tidak ada yang ditakuti selain Allah. Sikap ini perlu dihayati oleh seorang dai (juru dakwah) yang tugasnya sehari-hari mengajak manusia ke jalan Allah.

Ayat ini juga mengandung arti bahwa Nabi Muhammad diperintahkan supaya bertakbir yaitu membesarkan nama Tuhan-Nya, melebihi dari segala sesuatu yang ada. Sebab setelah manusia mengenal pencipta alam dan dirinya sendiri serta yakin bahwa pencipta itu memang ada, maka hendaklah dia membersihkan zat-Nya dari segala tandingan-Nya. Bila tidak demikian, orang musyrik pun mengagungkan nama tuhan mereka, akan tetapi keagungan yang berserikat dengan zat-zat lain.

Membesarkan Allah berarti mengagungkan-Nya dalam ucapan dan perbuatan, menyerahkan segala urusan hanya kepada-Nya, beribadah dan membersihkan zat-Nya dari segala yang dipersekutukan dengan-Nya, dan menggantungkan harapan kepada-Nya saja. Kalau unsur-unsur yang demikian dipenuhi dalam membesarkan Allah, barulah sempurna penghayatan iman bagi seorang mukmin.
text.4:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah memerintahkan Nabi Muhammad supaya membersihkan pakaian. Makna membersihkan pakaian menurut sebagian ahli tafsir adalah:

1.Membersihkan pakaian dari segala najis dan kotoran, karena bersuci dengan maksud beribadah hukumnya wajib, dan selain beribadah hukumnya sunah. Membersihkan di sini juga termasuk cara memperolehnya, yaitu pakaian yang digunakan harus diperoleh dengan cara yang halal. Ketika Ibnu 'Abbas ditanya orang tentang maksud ayat ini, beliau menjawab bahwa firman Allah tersebut berarti larangan memakai pakaian untuk perbuatan dosa dan penipuan. Jadi menyucikan pakaian adalah membersihkannya dari najis dan kotoran. Pengertian yang lebih luas lagi, yakni membersihkan tempat tinggal dan lingkungan hidup dari segala bentuk kotoran, sampah, dan lain-lain, sebab dalam pakaian, tubuh, dan lingkungan yang kotor banyak terdapat dosa. Sebaliknya dengan membersihkan badan, tempat tinggal, dan lain-lain berarti berusaha menjauhkan diri dari dosa. Demikianlah para ulama Syafi'iyah mewajibkan membersihkan pakaian dari najis bagi orang yang hendak salat. Begitulah Islam mengharuskan para pengikutnya untuk selalu hidup bersih, karena kebersihan jasmani mengangkat manusia kepada akhlak yang mulia.

2.Membersihkan pakaian berarti membersihkan rohani dari segala watak dan sifat-sifat tercela. Khusus buat Nabi Muhammad, ayat ini memerintahkan beliau menyucikan nilai-nilai nubuwwah (kenabian) yang dipikulnya dari segala yang mengotorinya (dengki, dendam, pemarah, dan lain-lain). Pengertian kedua ini bersifat kiasan (majazi), dan memang dalam bahasa Arab kadang-kadang menyindir orang yang tidak menepati janji dengan memakai perkataan, "Dia suka mengotori baju (pakaian)-nya," Sedangkan kalau orang yang suka menepati janji selalu dipuji dengan ucapan, "Dia suka membersihkan baju (pakaian)-nya."

Secara singkat, ayat ini memerintahkan agar membersihkan diri, pakaian, dan lingkungan dari segala najis, kotoran, sampah, dan lain-lain. Di samping itu juga berarti perintah memelihara kesucian dan kehormatan pribadi dari segala perangai yang tercela.
text.5:
Selanjutnya Nabi Muhammad diperintahkan supaya meninggalkan perbuatan dosa seperti menyembah berhala atau patung. Kata ar-rujz yang terdapat dalam ayat ini berarti siksaan, dan dalam hal ini yang dimaksudkan ialah perintah menjauhkan segala sebab yang mendatangkan siksaan, yakni perbuatan maksiat. Termasuk yang dilarang oleh ayat ini ialah mengerjakan segala macam perbuatan yang menyebabkan perbuatan maksiat.

Membersihkan diri dari dosa apalagi bagi seorang dai adalah suatu kewajiban. Sebab, kalau pada diri sang dai sendiri diketahui ada cela dan aib oleh masyarakat, tentu perkataan dan nasihatnya sulit diterima orang. Bahkan mubalig yang pandai memelihara diri sekali pun pasti menghadapi dua bentuk tantangan, yakni:

1.Boleh jadi orang yang diajak dan diseru ke jalan Allah akan menepuk dada, memperlihatkan kesombongannya, sehingga merasa tidak lagi membutuhkan nasihat. Dengan kekayaan, ilmu pengetahuan, atau kedudukan tinggi yang dimilikinya, ia merasa tidak perlu lagi diajak ke jalan Allah.

2.Mungkin pula sang dai dimusuhi oleh penguasa dan yang tidak senang kepadanya. Sang dai akan diusir, disiksa, dikurangi hak-haknya, diintimidasi, dilarang, atau dihalang-halangi menyampaikan dakwah dan menegakkan yang hak. Semuanya itu merupakan akibat yang harus dihadapi bagi siapa saja yang berjihad di jalan Allah. Memelihara diri dari segala tindakan dan perkataan yang melunturkan nama baik di mata masyarakat adalah sebagian dari ikhtiar dalam rangka mencapai kesuksesan dalam berdakwah.
text.6: Dalam ayat ini, Nabi Muhammad dilarang memberi dengan maksud memperoleh yang lebih banyak. Artinya dengan usaha dan ikhtiar mengajak manusia ke jalan Allah, serta dengan ilmu dan risalah yang disampaikan, beliau dilarang mengharapkan ganjaran atau upah yang lebih besar dari orang-orang yang diserunya. Tegasnya jangan menjadikan dakwah sebagai objek bisnis yang mendatangkan keuntungan duniawi. Bagi seorang nabi lebih ditekankan lagi agar tidak mengharapkan upah sama sekali dalam dakwah, guna memelihara keluhuran martabat kenabian yang dipikulnya.
text.7:
Ayat ini memerintahkan supaya Nabi Muhammad bersikap sabar, karena dalam berbuat taat itu pasti banyak rintangan dan cobaan yang dihadapi. Apalagi dalam berjihad untuk menyampaikan risalah Islam. Sabar dalam ayat ini juga berarti tabah menderita karena disiksa atau disakiti karena apa yang disampaikan itu tidak disenangi orang. Bagi seorang dai, ayat ini berarti bahwa ia harus dapat menahan diri dan menekan perasaan ketika misinya tidak diterima orang, dan ketika kebenaran yang diserukannya tidak dipedulikan orang. Janganlah putus asa, sebab tidak ada perjuangan yang berhasil tanpa pengorbanan, sebagaimana perjuangan yang telah dialami para nabi dan rasul.

Ada beberapa bentuk sabar yang ditafsirkan dari ayat di atas, di antaranya: (1) sabar dalam melakukan perbuatan taat, sehingga tidak dihinggapi kebosanan, (2) sabar menjauhkan diri dari perbuatan maksiat dan menghadapi musuh, (3) sabar ketika menghadapi cobaan dan ketetapan (qadar) Allah, dan (4) sabar menghadapi kemewahan hidup di dunia. Dengan sikap sabar dan tabah itulah sesuatu perjuangan dijamin akan berhasil, seperti yang diperlihatkan oleh junjungan kita, Nabi Muhammad saw.
text.8:
Setelah memberikan pengarahan khusus kepada Nabi Muhammad (yang juga menjadi cermin pengajaran bagi umat beliau) yang dimulai dari ayat 1 sampai dengan ayat 7 di atas, maka pada ayat ini, Allah menjelaskan pula tentang suasana kedatangan hari Kiamat. Di hari yang dijanjikan itu, orang-orang yang telah menyakiti hati para rasul dan juru dakwah karena menyampaikan ajaran Allah, akan mengalami suatu kesulitan yang luar biasa. Mereka tersentak mendengar seruan Kiamat ditiup Malaikat Israfil. Mereka langsung merasakan betapa hebatnya kesulitan yang harus ditempuh. Oleh karena itu, Allah memerintahkan Nabi Muhammad supaya bersabar menghadapi gangguan-gangguan musuh tersebut.

Pada hari Kiamat, semua orang mendapatkan apa yang telah mereka amalkan: kesenangan yang abadi bagi orang yang beriman dan berjihad menegakkan keimanan yang benar, serta kecelakaan dan kesengsaraan bagi siapa yang ingkar dan hidup di atas keingkaran itu.

text.10:
Dalam ayat ini ditegaskan lagi bahwa tidak mudah bagi orang-orang kafir menghadapi suasana hari Kiamat yang dahsyat dan menakutkan itu. Sebab, pada hari itulah mereka menerima segala hasil perbuatan mereka dalam buku amalan dari sebelah kiri sebagai tanda masuk neraka. Tidak ada lagi kebahagiaan bagi orang kafir pada hari tersebut. Semuanya serba susah dan pedih, tidak seperti kesenangan yang pernah mereka nikmati di dunia dahulu.

Kenapa mereka mengalami kesulitan? Selain pernah menerima buku di sebelah kiri, mereka juga harus mempertanggungjawabkan segala amal perbuatan mereka di hadapan Mahkamah Allah Yang Mahaadil, yang tidak seorang pun dapat mengelak dan tidak seorang pun yang merasa dirugikan. Sebab, di hari itu pula segala anggota tubuh ikut berbicara mengajukan kesaksian dengan sendirinya terhadap yang pernah dikerjakan, padahal mulut yang di dunia pandai bicara, pada hari itu terkunci rapat diam membisu seribu bahasa. Semua manusia pada hari Kiamat menundukkan kepala di hadapan Allah, mengakui kesalahan dan kekhilafan masa lalu, tetapi pintu penyesalan sudah ditutup. Adapun orang mukmin yang telah menggunakan waktu sebaik-baiknya untuk berjihad di jalan Allah, menghadapi kiamat dengan perasaan cerah, tanpa diliputi ketakutan sedikit pun. Mereka tidak akan dipersulit perhitungan amalnya, dan berjalan berbaris serta bersaf-saf menuju Mahkamah Ilahi dengan wajah cerah.
text.11:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah mengungkapkan bahwa Dialah yang akan berbuat sesuatu terhadap orang yang telah diciptakan-Nya sendiri. Dia telah menciptakan dan mengeluarkannya dari perut ibunya, tanpa harta bahkan tanpa anak. Lalu Dia menganugerahkan rezeki kepadanya, dan kepandaian memimpin kaumnya. Akan tetapi, dia membangkang kepada-Nya.

Ayat ini menyebutkan kata-kata "wahid" (satu-satunya), sebagai sindiran kepada al-Walid yang bergelar wahid, sebab dialah yang paling menonjol di kalangan kaumnya karena kekayaan, pangkat, dan harta yang dimilikinya. Al-Walid memiliki kebun ladang serta areal peternakan yang luas antara Mekah dan tha'if. Ia mempunyai unta, kuda, kambing, dan budak belian. Mempunyai tujuh orang anak yang perkasa (tiga di antaranya masuk Islam, yaitu Khalid, Hisyam, dan 'Imarah). Menurut Mujahid, putranya 10 orang. Lebih dari itu, Allah telah menganugerahkan usia panjang dengan kekayaan yang cukup kepada al-Walid itu (wafat dalam usia 90 tahun), dihormati dan disegani kaumnya.
text.12:
Allah mengungkapkan bahwa Dia memberikan kepada al-Walid harta yang banyak. Allah telah menganugerahinya berbagai macam harta, sehingga menjadi satu-satunya orang terkaya di kalangan kaumnya. Tidaklah mengherankan kalau sampai terlontar ucapan dari mulut al-Walid perkataan:

Sayalah satu-satunya anak dari satu-satunya di negeri ini, tiada seorang pun di kalangan Arab yang sepertiku atau seperti ayahku, al-Mugirah. (Riwayat al-Qurthubi)
text.13: Ayat ini mengungkapkan bahwa Allah pun menganugerahkan kepada hartawan dan bangsawan Quraisy ini putra yang selalu ikut serta bersamanya. Sebab dia orang kaya dan tidak memerlukan bantuan orang lain mengurus anaknya, maka anaknya tidak perlu mengembara ke negeri lain untuk mencari rezeki karena semuanya harus berdekatan dengan ayahnya sendiri. Ada pula yang mengartikan bahwa anak-anak al-Walid selalu mendampinginya apabila ia menghadiri pertemuan atau perayaan-perayaan, sehingga menimbulkan kesan akan kebesaran dan kemuliaannya. Putra-putra yang dibanggakan itu ada 7 orang (al-Walid, Khalid, 'Imarah Hisyam, 'As, Qais, dan 'Abdussyam). Tiga orang di antaranya (Khalid, Hisyam, dan 'Imarah) telah masuk Islam, memenuhi seruan Nabi Muhammad.
text.14:
Ayat ini mengutarakan bahwa Allah mencurahkan rezeki sebanyak-banyaknya kepada al-Walid berupa harta, anak, dan umur panjang. Ditambah lagi karunia berupa kedudukan yang tinggi di kalangan Quraisy, sehingga mendapat gelar terhormat sebagai "Raihanah Quraisy".

Seharusnya al-Walid bersyukur kepada Allah atas segenap nikmat dan kesenangan yang diterimanya. Akan tetapi, justru sebaliknya dia berpaling dari kebenaran dan bersikap keras kepala. Sifat seperti ini disebutkan dalam Al-Qur'an:

Segala puji bagi Allah yang telah menciptakan langit dan bumi, dan menjadikan gelap dan terang, namun demikian orang-orang kafir masih mempersekutukan Tuhan mereka dengan sesuatu. (al-An'am/6: 1)
text.15:
Ayat ini menyatakan bahwa al-Walid ingin sekali supaya Allah menambah kekayaannya, walaupun sudah demikian kaya dalam segala-galanya. Dia masih mengharapkan tambahan dari apa yang sudah ada. Begitulah watak manusia yang tidak kenal puas, tidak pernah terbatas angan-angan dan keinginannya. Watak ini akan selalu muncul sepanjang zaman. Rasulullah saw telah memperingatkan dalam sabdanya yang berbunyi:

Andaikata anak Adam (manusia) mempunyai satu lembah dari harta, pastilah ia menginginkan yang kedua dan jika ia memiliki dua lembah, pastilah ia menginginkan yang ketiga. (Riwayat al-Bukhari, Muslim, at-Tirmidhi, dan Ahmad dari Anas)

Dua orang yang banyak makan yang tidak pernah kenyang (yakni) penuntut ilmu dan pencari harta benda. (Riwayat ad-Darimi dari Ibnu 'Abbas). 

Kesombongan al-Walid memang keterlaluan sekali. Al-Qurthubi mengatakan bahwa al-hasan dan lainnya berkata, "Al-Walid pernah melontarkan ucapan:

Kalau memang Muhammad itu seorang yang benar, tentulah surga itu tidak diciptakan melainkan untuk saya. (Riwayat al-Qurthubi dan al-Alusi)
text.16:
Allah menegaskan bahwa sikap al-Walid itu tidak akan menambah apa yang diinginkannya, karena sesungguhnya ia menentang ayat-ayat-Nya. Allah sekali-kali tidak akan mengabulkan kehendaknya. Bahkan menurut riwayat, semenjak turunnya pernyataan Allah ini, harta dan kekayaan al-Walid semakin berkurang. Anak pun begitu, meninggal satu persatu sehingga habis semua. Akhirnya al-Walid tinggal sebatang kara.

Al-Walid selalu menunjukkan secara terang-terangan sikap menentang terhadap apa yang disampaikan Nabi Muhammad, berupa dalil-dalil tentang keesaan dan kekuasaan Allah, penjelasan tentang adanya hari kebangkitan, keterangan tentang risalah dan nubuat yang beliau bawa, dan lain-lain. Al-Walid menentang dengan keras wahyu Allah yang diturunkan melalui Muhammad saw. Oleh karena itu, ia berusaha pula hendak berbicara meniru gaya Al-Qur'an. Dia menganggap kalau Allah tetap hendak mengutus seorang rasul di kalangan bangsa Arab, maka tidak ada yang lebih pantas untuk menerima tugas suci itu melainkan dia sendiri. Begitulah kesombongan dan sikap keras kepala menghilangkan segala kesenangan duniawinya.

Segi lain yang kita ambil dari ayat ini adalah keingkaran al-Walid terhadap Allah dikategorikan kufur 'inad, maksudnya dia tahu betul dan mengakui dengan hati kecilnya bahwa apa yang disampaikan Nabi Muhammad adalah benar, namun lidah (ucapan) tetap mengingkarinya. Inilah jenis kekafiran yang paling kotor dan keji. Seperti banyak terdapat pada masa sekarang. Hati kecil mengakui ajaran agama itu benar dan menguntungkan, namun lidah tetap menentang karena berbagai faktor.
text.17:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menegaskan bahwa Dia akan memikulkan kepada al-Walid pendakian yang memayahkan. Maksudnya adalah Tuhan melemparkannya ke dalam neraka yang sangat dahsyat yang tidak ada sanggup ditahan sakitnya. Diibaratkan Allah bahwa kesukaran yang kelak dirasakan pada hari Kiamat diibaratkan seperti pendaki gunung yang disuruh memikul beban yang berat.

Dalam sebuah hadis diriwayatkan bahwa arti sa'ud (pendakian) dalam ayat ini adalah sebagai berikut:

Sa'ud adalah gunung api (di neraka) yang akan didaki oleh orang-orang kafir selama 70 tahun dan kemudian mereka (yang mendakinya) jatuh lagi ke bawah. Begitulah berulang-ulang untuk selama-lamanya. (Riwayat Ahmad dan at-Tirmidhi dari Abu Sa'id)

Ada yang mengartikan sa'ud itu dengan suatu azab yang kalau sudah menimpa seseorang, tidak akan pernah berhenti.
text.18: Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa sesungguhnya al-Walid memikirkan dan memahami wahyu Allah yang telah didengarnya. Akan tetapi, dia berusaha pula hendak menyusun kata-kata sendiri dengan maksud hendak mencela apa yang ada dalam Al-Qur'an. Dia mereka-reka perkataan lain yang bersifat menentang Al-Qur'an, sehingga orang Quraisy merasa senang dengannya, merasa cocok keinginan mereka dengan al-Walid.
text.19:
Allah mengutuk al-Walid dengan kata-kata "celakalah dia, bagaimana dia menetapkan?" Terkutuklah al-Walid dan orang Quraisy yang berbuat seperti itu. Sehubungan dengan hal ini, Allah berfirman:

Dan orang-orang Yahudi berkata, "Uzair putra Allah," dan orang-orang Nasrani berkata, "Al-Masih putra Allah." Itulah ucapan yang keluar dari mulut mereka. Mereka meniru ucapan orang-orang kafir yang terdahulu. Allah melaknat mereka; bagaimana mereka sampai berpaling? (at-Taubah/9: 30)
text.20: Maka celakalah al-Walid bagaimana dia menetapkan. Kata-kata ini diulang lagi oleh Allah. Begitu kerasnya kutukan Allah kepada al-Walid, karena dia telah menetapkan begitu saja bahwa apa yang diucapkan oleh Nabi Muhammad adalah sihir dan menuduh beliau sebagai tukang sihir, seperti disebutkan dalam ayat ke-24 di depan.
text.21: Kemudian al-Walid memikirkan berulang-ulang kalau-kalau ada suatu kesalahan dalam ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an. Ia juga berharap kalau-kalau ada ayat Al-Qur'an yang sesuai dengan keinginannya. Lalu dia teliti kembali boleh jadi ada titik kelemahan ayat yang dapat dijadikan senjata untuk mengkritik dan mencela Nabi Muhammad.
text.22: Ayat ini mengungkapkan bahwa al-Walid bermasam muka dan cemberut karena gagal mencari kelemahan Al-Qur'an, dan tidak tahu lagi apa yang harus diucapkan untuk mencelanya. Hal ini merupakan isyarat bahwa al-Walid dan orang-orang yang ahli seperti dia sebenarnya dalam hati kecilnya telah mengakui kebenaran Nabi Muhammad. Hanya saja sikap keras kepalanya (kufur 'inad) mendorongnya untuk mencaci dan mencela Nabi. Andaikata ia mantap pada keyakinannya akan kebenaran tersebut, tentu dia mendapat yang ia inginkan. Tidak mungkin dia berwajah cemberut yang melambangkan perasaan yang tidak puas.
text.23: Ayat ini mengungkapkan bahwa al-Walid berpaling dari kebenaran dan menyombongkan diri dengan memalingkan muka dari menatap kebenaran tersebut. Sambil menunjukkan keangkuhannya, ia sama sekali tidak mau tunduk dan patuh kepada kebenaran yang dibawa Nabi Muhammad.
text.24:
Ayat ini menegaskan bahwa al-Walid lalu mengatakan bahwa Al-Qur'an ini tidak lain hanyalah sihir yang dipelajari (dari orang-orang dahulu). Menurut dugaannya, Al-Qur'an adalah suatu ucapan yang disalin Muhammad dari orang lain yang lebih dahulu daripadanya, diterima dari orang yang bercerita kepadanya. 

Al-Walid juga mengatakan bahwa Al-Qur'an ini tidak lain hanyalah perkataan manusia. Maksudnya selain menuduh Al-Qur'an sebagai sihir yang bisa dipelajari, juga perkataan manusia biasa dan Muhammad mencurinya dari ucapan-ucapan orang lain. Secara ringkas, ia mengatakan bahwa Al-Qur'an bukan kalamullah seperti yang didakwahkan oleh Muhammad.

Andaikata tuduhan al-Walid itu benar, bahwa Al-Qur'an itu perkataan manusia biasa, tentu orang lain selain Muhammad saw sanggup pula menyusun seperti itu atau membuat tantangan yang lebih bagus lagi. Padahal di kalangan bangsa Arab banyak sekali terdapat tokoh-tokoh sastrawan yang lidahnya fasih bersyair dan berpidato. Di antara mereka, juga ada yang mendalam penguasaannya tentang berbagai macam ilmu pengetahuan. Namun demikian, tidak ada seorang pun yang sanggup menandingi ucapan yang keluar dari mulut Muhammad itu.

text.26: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menggambarkan balasan yang setimpal bagi orang yang begitu lancang menuduh Al-Qur'an sebagai ucapan manusia. Allah akan memasukkan al-Walid ke dalam neraka Saqar. Saqar adalah salah satu nama neraka.
text.27:
Ayat ini menggambarkan sifat neraka Saqar. Perkataan wa ma adra ka (dan tahukah engkau) dalam bahasa Arab menunjukkan besar dan sangat dahsyatnya masalah yang dipertanyakan. Apakah yang engkau ketahui tentang Saqar? Dan pasti tidak seorang pun mengetahuinya dan mencapai hakikatnya kecuali dengan keterangan yang diberikan oleh wahyu.

Saqar itu tidak meninggalkan dan tidak mengembalikan. Artinya setiap tubuh manusia yang di bakarnya, tidak satu pun yang tersisa dari daging maupun tulang. Kemudian tubuh yang telah hangus itu dikembalikan lagi menjadi baru dan segar, tetapi dibakar lagi sampai hangus untuk kedua kali dan seterusnya. Keterangan seperti itu kita peroleh dari ayat yang lain berbunyi:

Setiap kali kulit mereka hangus, Kami ganti dengan kulit yang lain, agar mereka merasakan azab. (an-Nisa'/4: 56)

Setiap kali kulit mereka hangus, Kami ganti dengan kulit yang lain, agar mereka merasakan azab. (an-Nisa'/4: 56)
text.29: Ayat ini menegaskan bahwa neraka Saqar itu pembakar kulit manusia. Maksudnya, Saqar itu membakar hangus kulit manusia sampai hitam warnanya. Makna kata lawwahah dalam ayat ini sebenarnya adalah "yang mengubah kulit menjadi hitam". Lebih hitam dari kegelapan malam.
text.30: Ayat ini menegaskan bahwa Saqar itu dijaga oleh 19 malaikat yang dikepalai oleh Malik. Diriwayatkan oleh al-Baihaqi dan Ibnu Mardawaih dari al-Bara' bahwa serombongan orang Yahudi pernah bertanya kepada sebagian sahabat Nabi tentang penjaga-penjaga neraka Jahanam. Mereka menjawab, "Allah dan Rasul-Nya yang lebih mengetahui." Kemudian turunlah Jibril kepada Rasulullah menerangkan tentang apa yang mereka tanyakan itu, seperti dalam ayat ke-30 ini.
text.31:
Pada permulaan ayat ini, Allah menegaskan bahwa petugas yang diangkat oleh Allah untuk mengurus urusan neraka dan memberikan siksaan kepada penghuninya adalah para malaikat. Mereka diberi kepercayaan mengatur dan mengawasinya. Mereka adalah makhluk Allah yang hebat dan perkasa serta bertindak atas perintah-Nya. Mereka bukan manusia dan bukan pula jin, sebab yang disiksa di sana adalah kedua makhluk itu. Andaikata penjaga neraka itu dari jenis manusia atau jin, tentu mereka akan kasihan dan lemah lembut kepada makhluk yang sejenis dengan mereka.

Adapun jumlah mereka yang sedikit itu (19 malaikat) dibandingkan dengan begitu luas neraka yang tiada bertepi yang harus diawasi serta puluhan miliar jin dan manusia yang mengisinya, hanyalah sekadar ujian dan cobaan bagi golongan yang tidak percaya. Sehingga mereka berkata seenaknya bahwa mereka sanggup berkelahi dengan malaikat, seperti ucapan Ibnu Kaladah di atas. Allah dengan sengaja menyebutkan jumlah yang sedikit itu agar orang kafir itu semakin congkak, sehingga berlipat-ganda pula pembalasan yang harus mereka derita.

Fitnah (cobaan) yang dimaksudkan di sini tentulah karena jumlah mereka yang terlalu sedikit. Hal itu bagi orang yang tidak percaya akan menimbulkan tanda tanya, "Bagaimana pula malaikat yang tidak sampai 20 itu sanggup mengendalikan jutaan bahkan ribuan juta jin dan manusia yang menghuni neraka? Padahal kalau mereka menyadari, sesungguhnya malaikat itu hanyalah sekadar alat belaka (atribut) yang bekerja atas perintah dan kekuasaan Allah. Biar pun hanya dua atau tiga malaikat, akan tetapi kalau Zat Yang Mahakuasa di belakangnya, pasti pekerjaan itu berjalan lancar.

Sebaliknya untuk orang yang telah diturunkan kitab (kaum Yahudi dan Nasrani) keterangan ayat ini seharusnya menambahkan keyakinan mereka akan kebenaran yang diucapkan oleh Nabi Muhammad. Sebab, jumlah yang 19 itu sesuai dengan keterangan yang mereka peroleh dalam kitab-kitab suci mereka (Taurat dan Injil). Allah sekaligus menegaskan bahwa antara kitab-kitab suci yang telah diturunkan-Nya itu tidak mungkin ada pertentangan satu sama lain. Orang beriman pasti akan bertambah yakin dengan keimanannya, sebab mereka melihat bagaimana orang ahli kitab membenarkan dan mengakui ayat Al-Qur'an, karena sesuai isinya dengan Taurat dan Injil.

Dengan demikian, orang-orang beriman dan golongan ahli kitab (Yahudi dan Nasrani) yang bersifat jujur tidak meragukan lagi pengertian kalimat 19 malaikat itu. Mereka (ahli kitab) juga tidak ragu lagi bagaimana hakikat iman seorang muslim, bahkan mereka diharapkan pula dapat menjelaskan hal demikian kepada orang yang masih ragu-ragu, seperti kepada golongan munafik dan lain-lain.

Di sini disebutkan tentang ahli kitab dan munafik, padahal ayatnya diturunkan di Mekah, dan orang ahli Kitab dan munafik baru muncul setelah Rasulullah saw berada di Medinah. Oleh karena itu, ayat ini harus dipandang sebagai berita gaib yang pasti akan terjadi yang disampaikan Allah kepada Nabi Muhammad. Menceritakan yang masih gaib atau belum terwujud termasuk salah satu bentuk mukjizat Nabi seperti disebutkan dalam kitab-kitab hadis.

Bagi orang-orang yang tidak percaya kepada kebenaran yang dibawa Nabi saw akan mempertanyakan kembali soal malaikat yang 19 itu. Apa sesungguhnya yang dikehendaki Allah dengan menyebutkan bilangan terlalu sedikit ini, dan kenapa tidak disebutkan 20 saja? Karena kebiasaan yang berlaku menyebut contoh/misal selalu menggunakan bilangan genap, maka perumpamaan Allah ini dipandang ganjil.

Lalu Allah menjelaskan, "Demikianlah Allah menyesatkan siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya dari golongan munafik dan musyrik yang selalu mempersoalkan jumlah bilangan malaikat itu. Akan tetapi, Dia pula yang memberikan petunjuk ke jalan yang benar bagi orang yang dikehendaki-Nya sehingga mereka paham dengan maksud ayat ini.

Dari keterangan ini jelaslah bagi kita bahwa perbedaan pendapat di kalangan manusia bahkan antara orang muslim adalah wajar, dan itu merupakan sunatullah. Hanya orang yang mendapat bimbingan akan memperoleh hakikat yang sebenarnya dari masalah yang dipersoalkan.

Allah kembali menegaskan kekuasaan-Nya bahwa hanya Dia yang tahu hakikat malaikat yang diperintahkan untuk mengawasi orang-orang kafir di neraka. Hanya Dia saja yang mengerti bagaimana sesungguhnya malaikat yang bertugas itu. Tidak ada seorang pun manusia yang mengerti hikmah menjadikan jumlah 19 itu. Ada yang menerangkan bahwa ayat ini turun sebagai jawaban dari ucapan Abu Jahal ketika mendengar ayat tentang penjaga neraka 19 orang itu, "Tahukah engkau bahwa Tuhan Muhammad itu cuma 19 malaikat saja penolong-Nya?" Yang jelas 19 malaikat itu dibantu oleh tentara Allah yang lain yang banyaknya tiada yang tahu melainkan Dia saja.

Ayat ini menegaskan bahwa neraka Saqar yang disertai dengan gambaran seperti diturunkan ayat di atas, merupakan peringatan bagi sekalian manusia.
text.32:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah memperingatkan bahwa tidak ada jalan bagi manusia untuk mengingkari kekuasaan-Nya yang nyata-nyata dapat mereka saksikan sendiri.

Kata-kata "kalla" (sekali-kali tidak) juga merupakan bantahan terhadap ucapan-ucapan orang musyrik di atas. Untuk menguatkan hal itu, Allah bersumpah dengan bulan, malam bila ia telah berlalu, dan bila subuh mulai bersinar. Dengan bulan, malam, dan subuh itu Allah menegaskan bahwa neraka Saqar itu merupakan suatu bencana yang amat dahsyat bagi umat manusia.

Ada yang menerangkan bahwa maksud ihda al-kubar (salah satu bencana yang sangat besar) adalah salah satu dari tujuh neraka yang dahsyat. Ketujuh lembah neraka (seperti yang disebutkan dalam ayat-ayat lain) itu adalah: Jahanam, Ladha, Huthamah, Sa'ir, Saqar, Jahim, dan Hawiyah.

Hal tersebut adalah sebagai ancaman bagi manusia. Adanya tujuh neraka itu (satu di antaranya Saqar) merupakan ancaman bagi yang masih tidak mau tunduk kepada kehendak Allah.

Ada yang mengartikan nadhir (yang memberi ancaman) itu adalah sifat Allah, sehingga arti ayat ini adalah: "Aku ini memberikan ancaman kepadamu, karena itu hendaklah kamu takut kepada ancaman itu". Ada yang mengartikan nadhir sebagai sifat Nabi Muhammad seperti disebutkan dalam ayat kedua di atas tadi.

Yang berkehendak maju atau mundur dalam ayat ini berarti "bagi siapa yang ingin mencapai kebaikan dan perbuatan taat sebanyak-banyaknya atau menjauhi kebaikan dan ketaatan itu sehingga terjatuh ke dalam lembah dosa dan maksiat".

Secara singkat dapat dijelaskan bahwa orang-orang kafir itu telah memahami tentang adanya neraka Saqar, siksaannya, dan para malaikat penjaganya. Terserah kepada mereka apakah akan segera menghindarinya dengan mengejar sebanyak mungkin perbuatan amal saleh dan taat, ataukah tetap menolak dan mengingkarinya, sehingga pada saat yang dijanjikan, mereka akan melihat sendiri buktinya.

Padahal mereka dapat berbuat demikian karena berlebihnya nikmat dan rezeki Allah yang mereka peroleh. Mereka tidak mau meringankan kesulitan fakir-miskin dengan sedekah yang seharusnya mereka keluarkan.
text.45: Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa mereka ikut terlibat dalam perbuatan orang yang tercela, yang tidak senang kepada Islam dan Nabi Muhammad dengan menuduh beliau pendusta atau tukang sihir yang gila. Mengenai Al-Qur'an mereka menganggapnya hanyalah sihir, syair, atau mantra untuk tenung. Pokoknya mereka terlibat dalam perbuatan kebatilan.

Artinya mereka mendustakan adanya hari hisab dan pembalasan atas segala perbuatan manusia, sampai datang kepada mereka keyakinan, yakni mati. Tegasnya mereka yakin dan melihat dengan mata kepala sendiri bahwa semuanya akan kembali kepada Allah di negeri akhirat.

Pada ayat ini, dalam nada cercaan, Allah bertanya, "Mengapa orang-orang kafir itu berpaling dari peringatan-Ku?" Maksudnya adalah kenapa orang-orang Mekah dan orang-orang seperti mereka menentang kebenaran Al-Qur'an yang telah memberikan peringatan-peringatan begitu hebat dan dahsyat kepada mereka?

Cara berpaling dari Allah (dari Al-Qur'an itu) ada dua macam, yaitu: pertama, bersifat keras kepala dan sama sekali tidak mengakuinya (mengingkarinya); kedua, meninggalkan amal perbuatan yang disuruh-Nya. Demikian pendapat Muqatil, salah seorang tabi'in.
text.50:
Kemudian digambarkan pula sikap orang-orang musyrik dan kafir itu menghindarkan diri dari peringatan agama. Mereka diibaratkan seperti keledai liar yang lari terkejut menjauh dari singa. Artinya mereka orang-orang musyrik itu lari dari Muhammad saw atau mereka yang kafir itu lari dari agama Islam, seperti keledai ketakutan lari dikejar singa, atau lari ketakutan karena diburu manusia (pemburu).

Ayat ini mengisyaratkan pula bahwa orang-orang yang seharusnya telah menerima seruan Islam dan mengambil pelajaran dari peringatan-peringatan yang diberikan Allah, malah justru menentangnya tanpa sebab-sebab yang logis. Di sini pula kita perbandingkan bagaimana seekor keledai lari ketakutan tanpa arah. Demikian pula manusia lari dari agama tanpa alasan yang tepat. Sifat berusaha menghindarkan diri dari kewajiban-kewajiban agama seperti itu kita lihat sekarang, memang sejak dari dulu telah digambarkan oleh Al-Qur'an.

text.52:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menyebutkan contoh sikap mereka yang keras kepala yang tidak dapat diterima akal sehat atau oleh hati yang berperasaan. Masing-masing mereka berkehendak supaya diberikan kepadanya lembaran-lembaran catatan yang terbuka (kitab). Setiap mereka menginginkan pula diturunkan wahyu seperti yang telah diterima Nabi Muhammad. Ditambah lagi kitab itu agak istimewa buat mereka, yakni dengan lembaran-lembaran terbuka yang turun dari langit.

Diriwayatkan oleh ahli-ahli tafsir bahwa serombongan kaum Quraisy datang kepada Rasulullah dan mengatakan, "Alangkah baiknya kalau setiap pemimpin kami mempunyai kitab dalam lembaran terbuka yang turun dari Allah. Dalam kitab itu dapat kami baca keterangan yang menyebutkan engkau, hai Muhammad, adalah rasul-Nya. Lembaran itu pula yang menyuruh kami mengimani engkau dan mengikuti agama engkau."

Dari Qatadah diterima keterangan bahwa maksud ayat di atas ialah mereka menghendaki bebas dari segala dosa-dosa tanpa bekerja dan berbuat kebaikan sedikit pun.

Diriwayatkan pula bahwa Abu Jahal bersama rombongannya yang terdiri dari pemuka-pemuka Quraisy mengatakan kepada Nabi, "Hai Muhammad, kami tidak akan beriman kepada engkau melainkan bila engkau beri masing-masing kami kitab itu alamatnya masing-masing yang berasal dari Tuhan dan terdapat pula di sana suruhan yang memerintahkan kami mengikuti agama engkau." Ungkapan demikian juga terdapat dalam salah satu ayat Al-Qur'an:

Dan kami tidak akan mempercayai kenaikanmu itu sebelum engkau turunkan kepada kami sebuah kitab untuk kami baca." Katakanlah (Muhammad), "Mahasuci Tuhanku, bukankah aku ini hanya seorang manusia yang menjadi rasul?" (al-Isra'/17: 93)
text.53:
Dengan nada cemooh, Allah menolak dengan tegas permintaan itu, sebab sebenarnya mereka tidak takut kepada hari akhirat. Artinya Allah tidak akan mengabulkan tuntutan mereka. Allah tidak akan menurunkan kitab dari langit khusus buat mereka.

Allah mengatakan dengan tegas bahwa sesungguhnya yang membuat jiwa mereka kasar, akhlak mereka jahat, penglihatan mereka tertutup, dan pendengaran mereka tersumbat dari kebenaran, adalah karena tidak percaya kepada hari akhirat dengan segala kedahsyatannya.

Andaikata permintaan mereka itu dikabulkan, tentu masih banyak permintaan-permintaan lain menyusul, sekadar menunjukkan iktikad mereka yang tidak baik kepada Islam. Sebab sudah cukup banyak dalil dan bukti-bukti kebenaran Nabi Muhammad untuk mereka. Lalu mereka minta kebenaran Nabi Muhammad buat mereka dan meminta lagi tambahan lain yang tidak pantas diminta, permintaan yang tidak berarti sama sekali.
text.54: Selanjutnya dalam ayat ini, Allah menegaskan lagi, "Sekali-kali tidak demikian halnya, sesungguhnya Al-Qur'an itu adalah peringatan." Al-Qur'an bukan sebagaimana yang mereka tuduhkan. Al-Qur'an bukan sihir yang dapat dipelajari, melainkan peringatan langsung dari Allah, sehingga tiada seorang pun yang dapat melepaskan diri dari pertanggungjawaban kepada Allah pada hari kemudian nanti.
text.55: Allah mengatakan bahwa barang siapa menghendaki Al-Qur'an sebagai petunjuk, niscaya dia mendapatkan pelajaran darinya. Siapa saja yang selalu ingat kepada Al-Qur'an, tidak melupakannya, dan menjadikan sebagai pedoman hidupnya, maka manfaatnya adalah untuk dirinya sendiri. Dalam Al-Qur'an terdapat kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat.
text.56:
Ayat ini menegaskan bahwa mereka tidak akan mengambil pelajaran dari Al-Qur'an kecuali jika Allah menghendakinya. Hanya Dia yang berhak memberi ampunan.

Tegasnya tidak ada yang memperoleh peringatan dan pengajaran dari Al-Qur'an melainkan siapa yang dikehendaki Allah. Tidak seorang pun yang sanggup berbuat demikian kecuali berdasarkan kekuasaan yang diberikan Allah. Begitulah Allah berbuat sekehendak-Nya tanpa terhalang oleh siapa pun. Oleh karena itulah kepada Allah saja manusia patut bertakwa, hanya Dia saja yang harus ditakuti dan Dia saja yang harus ditaati. Dialah memberikan ampunan kepada hamba-Nya yang beriman.

Dalam sebuah hadis disebutkan:

Bahwasanya Rasulullah saw, membaca ayat ini "huwa ahlut-takwa wa ahlul-magfirah" dan bersabda, "Tuhanmu berfirman, 'Sayalah yang paling patut ditakuti, maka janganlah dijadikan bersama-Ku Tuhan yang lain. Barang siapa yang takwa kepada-Ku dan sekali-kali ia tidak menjadikan bersama-Ku Tuhan yang lain, maka Aku-lah yang berhak untuk mengampuninya." (Riwayat Ahmad, ad-Darimi, at-Tirmizi, an-Nasa'i, dan Ibnu Majah dari Anas bin Malik)

text.1:
In verses 1-2, it is mentioned that Prophet Muhammad was wrapped in a blanket because he was overcome with fear upon seeing the form of the Angel Gabriel. Then, revelation descended, commanding him to immediately arise and warn the misguided people so that they might recognize the correct path.

The word "qum" (arise) indicates that a messenger must be diligent, persistent, and never give up despite the ridicule of those who are unhappy to accept his call. The Messenger must not be lazy or idle. From the moment this verse was revealed, Prophet Muhammad never ceased carrying out his mission of da'wah. His entire life was filled with various activities beneficial to the interests of the ummah and the propagation of Islam.

The warnings that he conveyed to the polytheistic inhabitants of Mecca at that time concerned the severity of Allah's punishment on the Day of Judgment. To save themselves from this torment, people should recognize Allah and obediently follow the commands of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him (saw).

The word "qum" (arise) indicates that a messenger must be diligent, persistent, and never give up despite the ridicule of those who are unwilling to accept his call. The Messenger must not be lazy and idle. Since the descent of this verse, Prophet Muhammad never ceased carrying out his mission of da'wah. His entire life was filled with various activities beneficial to the interests of the ummah and the propagation of the Islamic religion.

The warnings that he conveyed to the polytheistic inhabitants of Mecca at that time concerned the severity of Allah's punishment on the Day of Judgment. To save themselves from this torment, people should recognize Allah and obediently follow the commands of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him (saw).
text.3:
This verse commands Prophet Muhammad to glorify Allah by proclaiming His greatness (takbir) and entrusting all matters to His will. He is forbidden from seeking help from anyone other than Him.

Glorifying Allah with one's entire soul and body certainly cultivates a strong and unwavering personality. This is because a believer sees nothing to fear except Allah. This attitude needs to be embraced by a dai (preacher) whose daily task is to invite people to the path of Allah.

This verse also implies that Prophet Muhammad is commanded to proclaim Allah's greatness (takbir), exalting the name of his Lord above everything else. Because after a person knows the creator of the universe and himself, and is certain that the creator truly exists, then he should purify His essence from all rivals. Otherwise, even polytheists glorify the names of their gods, but a glorification that is associated with other entities.

Magnifying Allah means glorifying Him in word and deed, entrusting all matters only to Him, worshipping Him and purifying His essence from all that is associated with Him, and placing hope only in Him. If such elements are fulfilled in magnifying Allah, then the realization of faith for a believer is complete.
text.4:
In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad to purify his garments. The meaning of purifying garments according to some commentators of the Quran is:

1.  Purifying garments from all impurities and dirt, because purification with the intention of worship is obligatory, and other than for worship is sunnah (recommended). Purification here also includes the way of obtaining them, namely the garments used must be obtained in a halal (lawful) way. When Ibn 'Abbas was asked about the meaning of this verse, he replied that Allah's words meant a prohibition against wearing garments for sinful acts and deception. So, purifying garments is to cleanse them from impurities and dirt. A broader understanding is to cleanse dwellings and the environment from all forms of dirt, waste, and so on, because in dirty garments, bodies, and environments there are many sins. Conversely, by cleaning the body, dwelling, and so on, it means striving to distance oneself from sin. Thus, the scholars of the Shafi'i school obligate the purification of garments from impurities for those who intend to pray. That is how Islam requires its followers to always live cleanly, because physical cleanliness elevates humans to noble morals.

2.  Purifying garments means purifying the spirit from all reprehensible traits and characteristics. Specifically for the Prophet Muhammad, this verse commands him to purify the values of nubuwwah (prophethood) that he bears from all that defiles it (envy, resentment, anger, and so on). This second meaning is metaphorical (majazi), and indeed in Arabic, sometimes someone who does not keep promises is alluded to with the words, "He likes to dirty his garment (clothes)." Whereas if someone likes to keep promises, they are always praised with the saying, "He likes to clean his garment (clothes)."

In short, this verse commands us to purify ourselves, our garments, and our environment from all impurities, dirt, waste, and so on. Besides that, it also means an order to maintain the sanctity and honor of the individual from all reprehensible character traits.
text.5:
Furthermore, the Prophet Muhammad was commanded to abandon sinful acts such as worshipping idols or statues. The word *ar-rujz* found in this verse means punishment, and in this case, what is meant is the command to avoid all causes that bring punishment, namely, acts of disobedience. Included in what is prohibited by this verse is doing all kinds of actions that lead to acts of disobedience.

Purifying oneself from sin, especially for a *dai* (preacher), is an obligation. Because if the *dai* himself is known to have flaws and defects by the community, then his words and advice will certainly be difficult for people to accept. Even a *mubalig* (preacher) who is good at protecting himself will certainly face two forms of challenges, namely:

1. It is possible that the person who is invited and called to the path of Allah will beat his chest, showing his arrogance, so that he feels he no longer needs advice. With the wealth, knowledge, or high position he possesses, he feels he no longer needs to be invited to the path of Allah.

2. It is also possible that the *dai* will be opposed by the rulers and those who dislike him. The *dai* will be expelled, tortured, have his rights reduced, be intimidated, prohibited, or obstructed from conveying *dakwah* (preaching) and upholding what is right. All of these are consequences that must be faced by anyone who strives in the path of Allah. Protecting oneself from all actions and words that tarnish one's reputation in the eyes of the community is part of the effort to achieve success in *dakwah*.
text.6: In this verse, Prophet Muhammad is forbidden from giving with the intention of obtaining more. This means that through his efforts and endeavors in inviting people to the path of Allah, and through the knowledge and message he conveyed, he is forbidden from expecting a greater reward or compensation from those he called upon. In essence, he should not make da'wah (invitation to Islam) an object of business that brings worldly gain. For a prophet, it is even more emphasized that he should not expect any reward at all in da'wah, in order to preserve the nobility of the prophetic dignity he carries.
text.7:
This verse commands Prophet Muhammad to be patient, because in performing obedience, there will inevitably be many obstacles and trials faced. Especially in striving to convey the message of Islam. Patience in this verse also means steadfastly enduring suffering because of being tortured or hurt because what is conveyed is disliked by people. For a da'i (caller to Islam), this verse means that he must be able to restrain himself and suppress his feelings when his mission is not accepted, and when the truth he calls for is ignored. Do not despair, because no struggle succeeds without sacrifice, as the struggles experienced by the prophets and messengers.

There are several forms of patience interpreted from the verse above, including: (1) patience in performing acts of obedience, so as not to be overcome by boredom, (2) patience in abstaining from acts of disobedience and facing the enemy, (3) patience when facing trials and the decree (qadar) of Allah, and (4) patience in facing the luxuries of life in the world. With an attitude of patience and steadfastness, a struggle is guaranteed to succeed, as demonstrated by our leader, Prophet Muhammad saw.
text.8:
After providing specific guidance to the Prophet Muhammad (which also serves as a mirror of teaching for his followers) starting from verse 1 up to verse 7 above, in this verse, Allah also explains the atmosphere of the coming of the Day of Judgment. On that promised day, those who have hurt the hearts of the messengers and preachers for conveying the teachings of Allah, will experience extraordinary difficulty. They are startled to hear the call of the Day of Judgment being blown by the Angel Israfil. They immediately feel how great the difficulties that must be faced are. Therefore, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad to be patient in facing the disturbances of these enemies.

On the Day of Judgment, everyone will receive what they have practiced: eternal pleasure for those who believe and strive to uphold true faith, and misfortune and misery for those who disbelieve and live in disbelief.

text.10:
In this verse, it is further emphasized that it is not easy for the disbelievers to face the terrible and frightening atmosphere of the Day of Judgment. Because, on that day, they will receive the results of all their deeds in the book of deeds from the left side as a sign of entering hell. There will be no happiness for the disbelievers on that day. Everything will be difficult and painful, unlike the pleasures they once enjoyed in the world.

Why do they experience difficulties? Besides receiving the book on the left side, they must also account for all their deeds before the Court of Allah, the Most Just, from which no one can escape and no one will feel disadvantaged. Because, on that day, all the limbs will speak, presenting testimony on their own regarding what was done, even though the mouth that was eloquent in the world, on that day will be tightly locked, silent and speechless. All humans on the Day of Judgment will bow their heads before Allah, acknowledging past mistakes and errors, but the door of repentance will be closed. As for the believers who have used their time wisely to strive in the path of Allah, they will face the Day of Judgment with a bright feeling, without being overcome by any fear. Their reckoning will not be made difficult, and they will walk in rows and ranks towards the Divine Court with bright faces.
text.11:
In this verse, Allah reveals that He is the One who will do something to the person He Himself created. He created him and brought him forth from his mother's womb, without wealth or even children. Then He bestowed sustenance upon him, and the ability to lead his people. However, he disobeyed Him.

This verse mentions the word "wahid" (the only one), as an allusion to al-Walid, who was titled wahid, because he was the most prominent among his people due to his wealth, rank, and possessions. Al-Walid possessed vast orchards, fields, and ranching areas between Mecca and Ta'if. He had camels, horses, goats, and slaves. He had seven strong sons (three of whom embraced Islam, namely Khalid, Hisham, and 'Imarah). According to Mujahid, he had 10 sons. Moreover, Allah had bestowed upon al-Walid a long life with sufficient wealth (he died at the age of 90), and he was respected and revered by his people.
text.12:
Allah reveals that He gave al-Walid abundant wealth. Allah had bestowed upon him various kinds of riches, making him the wealthiest person among his people. It is not surprising that the following statement came from al-Walid's mouth:

"I am the only son of the only one in this land, there is no one among the Arabs like me or like my father, al-Mughirah." (Narrated by al-Qurthubi)
text.13: This verse reveals that Allah also bestowed upon this wealthy and noble Qurayshite sons who always accompanied him. Because he was rich and did not need the help of others to care for his child, his child did not need to wander to other lands to seek sustenance, as everything had to be close to his father. Some also interpret it to mean that al-Walid's sons always accompanied him when he attended meetings or celebrations, thus creating an impression of his greatness and nobility. These sons, of whom he was proud, numbered 7 (al-Walid, Khalid, 'Imarah Hisyam, 'As, Qais, and 'Abdussyam). Three of them (Khalid, Hisyam, and 'Imarah) embraced Islam, answering the call of the Prophet Muhammad.
text.14:
This verse states that Allah bestowed upon al-Walid abundant sustenance in the form of wealth, children, and a long life. Furthermore, he was granted the blessing of a high position among the Quraysh, earning him the honorable title of "Raihanah Quraysh."

Al-Walid should have been grateful to Allah for all the blessings and pleasures he received. However, he did the opposite, turning away from the truth and being stubborn. This kind of behavior is mentioned in the Qur'an:

All praise is [due] to Allah, who created the heavens and the earth and made the darknesses and the light; then those who disbelieve equate [others] with their Lord. (al-An'am/6: 1)
text.15:
This verse states that al-Walid desperately wanted Allah to increase his wealth, even though he was already so rich in everything. He still hoped for additions to what he already had. Such is the nature of man, who is never satisfied, whose dreams and desires are never limited. This character will always appear throughout the ages. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) warned in his saying:

"If the son of Adam (man) had one valley of wealth, he would surely desire a second, and if he had two valleys, he would surely desire a third." (Narrated by al-Bukhari, Muslim, at-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad from Anas)

"Two gluttons who are never satisfied are the seeker of knowledge and the seeker of wealth." (Narrated by ad-Darimi from Ibn 'Abbas).

Al-Walid's arrogance was indeed excessive. Al-Qurthubi said that al-Hasan and others said, "Al-Walid once uttered the words:

"If Muhammad is indeed truthful, then Paradise would not have been created except for me." (Narrated by al-Qurthubi and al-Alusi)
text.16:
Allah affirms that al-Walid's attitude will not add to what he desires, because indeed he opposes His verses. Allah will never grant his wishes. In fact, according to narrations, since the revelation of this statement from Allah, al-Walid's wealth and riches have steadily decreased. The same with his children, dying one by one until they were all gone. Eventually, al-Walid was left all alone.

Al-Walid always openly showed his opposition to what Prophet Muhammad conveyed, in the form of proofs about the oneness and power of Allah, explanations about the existence of the Day of Resurrection, information about the message and prophecy he brought, and others. Al-Walid strongly opposed the revelation of Allah that was revealed through Muhammad saw. Therefore, he also tried to speak imitating the style of the Qur'an. He considered that if Allah still intended to send a messenger from among the Arabs, then no one was more worthy to receive that sacred task than himself. Thus, his arrogance and stubbornness eliminated all his worldly pleasures.

Another aspect we take from this verse is that al-Walid's denial of Allah is categorized as *kufr 'inad*, meaning he knows very well and acknowledges in his heart that what Prophet Muhammad conveyed is true, but his tongue (speech) still denies it. This is the most vile and heinous type of disbelief. As is often found in the present day. The heart acknowledges that religious teachings are true and beneficial, but the tongue still opposes them due to various factors.
text.17:
In this verse, Allah affirms that He will burden al-Walid with a grueling ascent. The meaning is that God will cast him into a terrible hell, the pain of which no one can bear. Allah likens the hardship that will be felt on the Day of Judgment to a mountain climber ordered to carry a heavy burden.

In a hadith, it is narrated that the meaning of sa'ud (ascent) in this verse is as follows:

Sa'ud is a fiery mountain (in hell) that the disbelievers will climb for 70 years and then they (who climb it) will fall back down. This will repeat forever. (Narrated by Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi from Abu Sa'id)

Some interpret sa'ud as a torment that, once it befalls someone, will never cease.
text.18: This verse explains that al-Walid indeed contemplated and understood the revelation of Allah that he had heard. However, he also tried to compose his own words with the intention of criticizing what was in the Qur'an. He fabricated other statements that were meant to oppose the Qur'an, so that the Quraysh would be pleased with him, feeling that their desires aligned with al-Walid.
text.19:
Allah cursed al-Walid with the words "Woe to him, how did he determine?" Cursed be al-Walid and the Quraysh who acted like that. In connection with this, Allah says:

And the Jews say, "Ezra is the son of Allah," and the Christians say, "The Messiah is the son of Allah." That is their statement from their mouths. They imitate the saying of those who disbelieved before. May Allah curse them; how are they turned away? (at-Taubah/9: 30)
text.20: Then woe to al-Walid, how he determines! These words are repeated again by Allah. So severe is Allah's curse upon al-Walid, because he has simply determined that what the Prophet Muhammad said is magic and accused him of being a magician, as mentioned in verse 24 above.
text.21: Then al-Walid repeatedly pondered whether there was any error in the verses of the Qur'an. He also hoped that there might be a verse of the Qur'an that aligned with his desires. Then he examined it again, hoping to find a weak point in the verse that could be used as a weapon to criticize and reproach the Prophet Muhammad.
text.22: This verse reveals that al-Walid frowned and scowled because he failed to find weaknesses in the Qur'an, and no longer knew what to say to criticize it. This is an indication that al-Walid and people who were experts like him had actually acknowledged the truth of the Prophet Muhammad in their hearts. It was only his stubbornness (kufur 'inad) that drove him to revile and denounce the Prophet. If he had been steadfast in his belief in that truth, he would certainly have obtained what he desired. It would have been impossible for him to have a scowling face, which symbolized feelings of dissatisfaction.
text.23: This verse reveals that al-Walid turned away from the truth and boasted by averting his face from looking at that truth. While showing his arrogance, he absolutely refused to submit and obey the truth brought by the Prophet Muhammad.
text.24:
This verse affirms that al-Walid then said that this Quran is nothing but magic that has been learned (from people of the past). According to his assumption, the Quran is a statement copied by Muhammad from others who came before him, received from someone who told him.

Al-Walid also said that this Quran is nothing but the words of men. His intention, besides accusing the Quran of being magic that can be learned, was also that it is the words of ordinary men and that Muhammad stole it from the sayings of others. In short, he said that the Quran is not *kalamullah* (the word of Allah) as claimed by Muhammad.

If al-Walid's accusation were true, that the Quran is the words of ordinary men, then surely others besides Muhammad saw would be able to compose something like it or create an even better challenge. In fact, among the Arab people, there were many literary figures whose tongues were eloquent in poetry and oratory. Among them, there were also those who had a deep mastery of various kinds of knowledge. Nevertheless, no one was able to match the words that came out of Muhammad's mouth.

text.26: In this verse, Allah describes the fitting recompense for those who so brazenly accuse the Qur'an of being the speech of man. Allah will cast al-Walid into the Saqar Fire. Saqar is one of the names of Hell.
text.27:
This verse describes the nature of Saqar hell. The phrase *wa ma adra ka* (and what will make you know) in Arabic indicates the magnitude and extreme severity of the matter being questioned. What will make you know about Saqar? And surely no one knows it and reaches its reality except with the information provided by revelation.

Saqar leaves nothing and spares nothing. This means that every human body it burns, not a single piece of flesh or bone remains. Then the body that has been burned to ashes is restored to new and fresh, but burned again until it is charred for the second time and so on. We obtain such information from another verse that reads:

Every time their skins are roasted through, We shall change them for fresh skins that they may taste the penalty. (an-Nisa'/4: 56)
text.28:
This verse describes the nature of Saqar hell. The phrase *wa ma adra ka* (and what will make you know) in Arabic indicates the enormity and extreme awfulness of the matter being questioned. What will make you know what Saqar is? And surely no one knows it and reaches its true essence except with the information provided by revelation.

Saqar neither leaves nor spares. This means that every human body it burns, not a single part of the flesh or bones remains. Then the body that has been burned is returned to a new and fresh state, but is burned again until it is charred for the second time and so on. We obtain such information from another verse which reads:

"Every time their skins are roasted through, We shall replace them with other skins, that they may taste the punishment." (an-Nisa'/4: 56)
text.29: This verse affirms that Saqar (Hell) burns the skin of humans. Meaning, Saqar burns the skin of humans until it is charred black. The meaning of the word *lawwahah* in the verse is actually "that which changes the skin to black," blacker than the darkness of night.
text.30: This verse affirms that Saqar is guarded by 19 angels headed by Malik. It is narrated by al-Baihaqi and Ibn Mardawaih from al-Bara' that a group of Jews once asked some of the Prophet's companions about the guardians of Hell. They answered, "Allah and His Messenger know best." Then Jibril descended to the Messenger of Allah explaining what they had asked about, as in verse 30.
text.31:
At the beginning of this verse, Allah affirms that the officers appointed by Allah to manage the affairs of Hell and inflict punishment upon its inhabitants are the angels. They are entrusted with regulating and overseeing it. They are Allah's mighty and powerful creatures who act upon His command. They are neither humans nor jinn, because those who are punished there are these two creatures. If the guardians of Hell were of the human or jinn kind, they would surely have compassion and gentleness towards creatures of their own kind.

As for their small number (19 angels) compared to the vastness of the boundless Hell that must be overseen, and the tens of billions of jinn and humans who fill it, it is merely a test and trial for those who do not believe. So that they say whatever they please, that they are able to fight with the angels, like the statement of Ibn Kaladah above. Allah deliberately mentions the small number so that the disbelievers become more arrogant, so that the punishment they must suffer is multiplied.

The *fitnah* (trial) meant here is certainly because of their too small number. For those who do not believe, it will raise the question, "How can angels who are not even 20 control millions or even billions of jinn and humans who inhabit Hell?" Whereas if they realized, the angels are actually just mere tools (attributes) that work on the command and power of Allah. Even if there are only two or three angels, but if the Almighty is behind them, surely the work will run smoothly.

Conversely, for those to whom the Book has been revealed (the Jews and Christians), the explanation of this verse should increase their conviction in the truth spoken by the Prophet Muhammad. Because the number 19 corresponds to the information they obtained in their holy books (the Torah and the Gospel). Allah also affirms that there can be no contradiction between the holy books that He has revealed. Believers will surely become more confident in their faith, because they see how the People of the Book confirm and acknowledge the verses of the Qur'an, because its contents are in accordance with the Torah and the Gospel.

Thus, the believers and the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) who are honest no longer doubt the meaning of the phrase 19 angels. They (the People of the Book) also no longer doubt the reality of a Muslim's faith, and they are even expected to be able to explain this to those who are still hesitant, such as the hypocrites and others.

Here it is mentioned about the People of the Book and the hypocrites, even though the verse was revealed in Mecca, and the People of the Book and the hypocrites only appeared after the Messenger of Allah (saw) was in Medina. Therefore, this verse must be seen as a hidden news that will surely happen that Allah conveyed to the Prophet Muhammad. Telling what is still hidden or has not yet materialized is one form of the Prophet's miracle as mentioned in the books of *hadith*.

For those who do not believe in the truth brought by the Prophet (saw), they will question again about the 19 angels. What does Allah actually intend by mentioning this too small number, and why not mention 20? Because the prevailing custom of mentioning examples always uses even numbers, this parable of Allah is considered odd.

Then Allah explains, "Thus does Allah leave to stray whom He wills from among the hypocrites and polytheists who always question the number of angels. But He also gives guidance to the right path to whom He wills so that they understand the meaning of this verse.

From this explanation, it is clear to us that differences of opinion among humans, even among Muslims, are natural, and that is *sunnatullah*. Only those who receive guidance will obtain the true essence of the issue in question.

Allah again affirms His power that only He knows the reality of the angels who are ordered to watch over the disbelievers in Hell. Only He understands what the angels who are on duty are really like. No human being understands the wisdom of making the number 19. Some explain that this verse was revealed as an answer to the words of Abu Jahl when he heard the verse about the guardians of Hell being 19 people, "Do you know that Muhammad's God only has 19 angels to help Him?" What is clear is that the 19 angels are assisted by Allah's other soldiers, whose number no one knows except Him.

This verse affirms that Saqar Hell, accompanied by the description as revealed in the verse above, is a warning to all mankind.
text.32:
In these verses, Allah warns that there is no way for humans to deny His power, which they can clearly witness for themselves.

The word "kalla" (nay, never) is also a refutation of the statements of the polytheists mentioned above. To reinforce this, Allah swears by the moon, the night when it has passed, and when dawn begins to shine. With the moon, the night, and the dawn, Allah affirms that the Saqar Fire is a terrible disaster for mankind.

Some explain that the meaning of *ihda al-kubar* (one of the greatest calamities) is one of the seven terrible hells. The seven valleys of hell (as mentioned in other verses) are: Jahannam, Ladha, Huthamah, Sa'ir, Saqar, Jahim, and Hawiyah.

This is a threat to mankind. The existence of the seven hells (one of which is Saqar) is a threat to those who still refuse to submit to the will of Allah.

Some interpret *nadhir* (the warner) as an attribute of Allah, so the meaning of this verse is: "I am giving you a warning, therefore you should fear that warning." Some interpret *nadhir* as an attribute of the Prophet Muhammad, as mentioned in the second verse above.

text.37:
Allah affirms that the threat is directed at anyone who wants to accept or reject it. It is permissible to reject the threat, but they will feel the consequences, as was the case with al-Walid mentioned in the previous verse. "To advance or recede" in this verse means "for whoever wants to achieve as much good and obedience as possible, or to avoid good and obedience, thus falling into the valley of sin and disobedience."

In short, it can be explained that the disbelievers have understood about the Saqar Hellfire, its torment, and the angels guarding it. It is up to them whether they will immediately avoid it by pursuing as many good deeds and obedience as possible, or whether they will continue to reject and deny it, so that at the appointed time, they will see the proof for themselves.

From verse 37, Ibn 'Abbas concludes that in addition to the words being a threat (tahdid), it is also an announcement that whoever believes in and obeys the Prophet Muhammad will surely be rewarded with unending rewards, while whoever rejects the truth of Muhammad saw and denies him will be punished with unending torment.
text.38:
In this verse, Allah affirms that every human soul is mortgaged with Allah. Whether Muslim or disbeliever, denying or obedient, all are dependent on Allah. Each soul is bound by the deeds it performs until the Day of Judgment, except for the people of the Right Hand (ashab al-yamin). This means they can release their attachment with Allah through the good deeds they perform, just as a person can free themselves from the status of being mortgaged because they have fulfilled their obligations.

The people of the Right Hand referred to are the sincere believers, who receive their book of deeds in their right hand on the Day of Judgment. However, some say that the people of the Right Hand in this verse are children whose sins and wrongdoings have not yet been accounted for. There are even those who believe that the people of the Right Hand are the angels.
text.39:
In this verse, Allah affirms that every human soul is mortgaged with Allah. Whether Muslim or disbeliever, those who deny or those who are obedient, all are dependent on Allah. Each soul is bound by the deeds it performs until the Day of Judgment, except for the Companions of the Right. This means they can release their bondage with Allah through the good deeds they perform, just as a person can release themselves from the status of being mortgaged because they have fulfilled their obligations.

The Companions of the Right referred to are the sincere believers who will receive their book of deeds in their right hand on the Day of Judgment. However, some say that the Companions of the Right in this verse are children whose sins and wrongdoings have not yet been accounted for. There are even those who believe that the Companions of the Right are the angels.
text.40:
This verse further explains that the people of the right are in Paradise, asking each other about the fate of the rebellious. They are greeted by angels with the greeting of peace, as Allah says:

"Then, 'Peace be upon you' (from) the companions of the right." (the angels will say). (al-Waqi'ah/56: 91)

And Allah says:

"And its keepers will say, "Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally therein." (az-Zumar/39: 73)
text.41:

"Then, 'Peace be upon you' (from the angels) to those on the right." (al-Waqi'ah/56: 91)

And Allah says:

"And its keepers will say, "Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally therein." (az-Zumar/39: 73)
text.42:
This verse explains that the people of the right are in the chambers of Paradise, full of pleasure, while the sinful are immersed in the torment of Hell. Nevertheless, they can ask each other, "Why were you brought into that Hell?"

They answer honestly and frankly that they did not perform prayer (salat) in the world before, unlike the believers who continued to perform prayer. Because at that time they were not even slightly convinced that it was actually commanded by Allah.
text.43:
This verse explains that the people of the Right Hand will be in the chambers of Paradise, filled with delights, while the sinful will be immersed in the torment of Hell. Nevertheless, they will be able to ask each other, "What has brought you into Hell?"

They will answer honestly and frankly that they did not perform the salat (prayer) in the world, unlike the believers who consistently performed the salat. Because at that time, they were not even slightly convinced that it was actually commanded by Allah.
text.44: This verse explains that they are not among those who consistently do good to the poor and weak. Even though they are capable of doing so because of the abundance of blessings and sustenance from Allah that they have obtained. They are unwilling to alleviate the difficulties of the poor and needy with the *sedekah* (charity) that they should be giving.
text.45: This verse explains that they are involved in the deeds of the reprehensible, those who are displeased with Islam and the Prophet Muhammad by accusing him of being a liar or a mad magician. Regarding the Qur'an, they consider it to be merely magic, poetry, or incantations for sorcery. In short, they are involved in falsehood (batil).
text.46:
This verse expresses their further admission that they denied the Hereafter. Meaning, they denied the Day of Reckoning and the recompense for all human actions, until certainty came to them, which is death. Clearly, they became certain and saw with their own eyes that everything would return to Allah in the Hereafter.

Then, the intercession of intercessors will not benefit them. Meaning, if someone possesses characteristics as mentioned in the verse above (does not perform prayer, does not care about providing for the poor and needy, is involved in the actions of those who like to criticize, denies the coming of the Hereafter), no intercession (help) will be useful to save them from the torment of Hellfire. Because intercession is only useful for those who are entitled to receive it.

text.49:
In this verse, in a tone of reproach, Allah asks, "Why do those who disbelieve turn away from My warning?" The meaning is, why do the people of Mecca and those like them oppose the truth of the Qur'an, which has given them such great and terrible warnings?

There are two ways to turn away from Allah (from the Qur'an): first, being stubborn and not acknowledging it at all (denying it); second, abandoning the deeds that He commands. This is the opinion of Muqatil, one of the *tabi'in*.
text.50:
Then, the attitude of the polytheists and disbelievers in avoiding religious reminders is also depicted. They are likened to wild donkeys running startled away from a lion. This means that those polytheists flee from Muhammad (peace be upon him), or those disbelievers flee from the religion of Islam, like donkeys terrified running chased by a lion, or running terrified because they are hunted by humans (hunters).

This verse also indicates that those who should have accepted the call of Islam and learned from the warnings given by Allah, instead oppose it without logical reasons. Here, we also compare how a donkey runs away in fear without direction. Similarly, humans run away from religion without proper reason. Such behavior of trying to avoid religious obligations, as we see it now, has indeed been described by the Qur'an since the beginning.
text.51:
Then, the attitude of the polytheists and disbelievers in avoiding religious reminders is also described. They are likened to wild donkeys fleeing in shock from a lion. This means that those polytheists flee from Muhammad (peace be upon him), or those disbelievers flee from the religion of Islam, like donkeys fleeing in fear of being chased by a lion, or fleeing in fear of being hunted by humans (hunters).

This verse also indicates that those who should have accepted the call of Islam and learned from the warnings given by Allah, instead oppose it without logical reasons. Here, we also compare how a donkey runs away in fear without direction. Similarly, humans flee from religion without valid reasons. Such an attitude of trying to avoid religious obligations, as we see it now, has indeed been described by the Qur'an since ancient times.
text.52:
In this verse, Allah mentions an example of their stubborn attitude, unacceptable to common sense or a feeling heart. Each of them desires to be given open pages of records (kitab). Each of them also desires that revelation be sent down as received by Prophet Muhammad. Furthermore, they want the kitab to be special for them, with open pages descending from the sky.

It is narrated by the scholars of tafsir that a group of Quraysh came to the Messenger of Allah and said, "How good it would be if each of our leaders had a kitab in open pages that descended from Allah. In that kitab, we could read an explanation stating that you, O Muhammad, are His messenger. That page would also command us to believe in you and follow your religion."

From Qatadah, it is received that the meaning of the verse above is that they desire to be free from all sins without working or doing any good deeds at all.

It is also narrated that Abu Jahal, along with his group consisting of the leaders of the Quraysh, said to the Prophet, "O Muhammad, we will not believe in you unless you give each of us a kitab with their respective addresses, originating from God, and containing commands ordering us to follow your religion." A similar expression is also found in one of the verses of the Qur'an:

"And we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we can read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever anything but a human messenger?" (al-Isra'/17: 93)
text.53:
With a mocking tone, Allah firmly rejects that request, because in reality they do not fear the Hereafter. Meaning, Allah will not grant their demands. Allah will not send down a book from the sky specifically for them.

Allah states firmly that what makes their souls harsh, their morals evil, their vision closed, and their hearing blocked from the truth, is because they do not believe in the Hereafter with all its terrors.

Even if their request were granted, surely many other requests would follow, merely to demonstrate their ill intentions towards Islam. Because there are already plenty of proofs and evidence of the truth of Prophet Muhammad for them. Then they ask for the truth of Prophet Muhammad for themselves and ask for other inappropriate additions, requests that are completely meaningless.
text.54: Furthermore, in this verse, Allah affirms again, "Nay, indeed, this is a reminder." The Qur'an is not as they accuse it of being. The Qur'an is not magic that can be learned, but rather a direct reminder from Allah, so that no one can escape accountability to Allah on the Day of Judgment.
text.55: Allah says that whoever desires the Qur'an as guidance, then surely they will gain a lesson from it. Whoever always remembers the Qur'an, does not forget it, and makes it a guide in their life, then its benefit is for themselves. In the Qur'an there is happiness in this world and the hereafter.
text.56:
This verse affirms that they will not take lessons from the Qur'an except if Allah wills it. Only He has the right to grant forgiveness.

Emphatically, no one obtains a warning and teaching from the Qur'an except those whom Allah wills. No one is able to do so except based on the power given by Allah. Thus, Allah acts as He wills without being hindered by anyone. Therefore, it is to Allah alone that mankind should be pious, only He should be feared, and only He should be obeyed. He grants forgiveness to His believing servants.

In a hadith it is mentioned:

That the Messenger of Allah (saw) recited this verse "huwa ahlut-takwa wa ahlul-magfirah" and said, "Your Lord says, 'I am the most worthy of being feared, so do not associate any other god with Me. Whoever is pious to Me and never associates any other god with Me, then I am the One who has the right to forgive him.'" (Narrated by Ahmad, ad-Darimi, at-Tirmizi, an-Nasa'i, and Ibn Majah from Anas bin Malik)
